author: jerenkrantz
msg: Move the SERF_DECLARE macros to its own header files.
(serf_buckets.h needs these macros as well.)

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Add initial build system based on flood's system with enough modifications
to make this work.
This can build an libserf.la file with a mock (almost empty) serf_connection.c
file.
Obtained from: Flood

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Clean up types so that the file actually compiles.
(apr_bucket_brigade and apr_uri)
Not bad for doing these headers blind.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: autoconf should be sent to the detention room without any soup.
(It does rm -rf core in its generated configure script.)

author: jerenkrantz
msg: - Remove serf_methods.h as Greg has shown me the light (for now).  serf
doesn't care a whit about the methods - it can send whatever it wants.
The server must be the one who rejects it.
- Consolidate the uri components to a single uri_path variable.
- Note why keepalive is present.
- Add note about synchronous handling - the handlers are NULL...
What would happen if we call the synch funcs when we have async handlers?
- Don't associate a connection with a request.  I'm thinking about reusing
a serf_request_t object across multiple connections.  That could work!
The relationship would only be stored in the connection.
- Add response filters in the request object as the response object is
created too late to give it per-response filters.  The response object
is only created as we receive data (in essence, it is just a big brigade).
- Remove serf_create_response call as that isn't very helpful, IMHO.
- Add pool parameter to serf_open_uri call.
